comments.body: No way , I mean yes the behavior but not the headless part
It would definitely be useful to be able to see which villagers are in near danger.
This would be really cool because it will make things more realistic, and maybe stop people from killing our bald buddies.
Very good idea!

Could be the brow ord tornado, but if it is the tornado I think it should happen every once in a while to show it, so it doesn't get annoying being continuous. So if we give them food should they eat the food to heal.
The tornado feature is better in my opinion.

I like the idea of having a wandering barterer, but I do feel that the items suggested are a bit too much. I also think that it should be a little more cautious than the piglins, and only fight if attacked or if it finds a creature with something valuable or useful. This could make a great way to obtain rare items useful to nether survival, though!
I think the Ravager Head should also drop from the Ravager too.
Should get more attention because this rocks! How about a roster in multiplayer?
Also what if they can talk English in chat and not go ehhhh
use ms chat ai to do chat

My idea is similar enough to put here.

Terracotta Golems start off as Clay Golems, they are created with 1 clay block topped with a pumpkin, and are 1.5 blocks tall. They have 2 Hearts of health, and deal 3 damage per swing. When they catch fire, they morph into Terracotta Golems, which are basically the same as Clay Golems, but tougher. They have 5 Hearts of health, and deal 4 damage per swing. They are built in smaller villages (8 or less villagers) like your idea, but can have much greater numbers because of the smaller amount of materials required, closer to 8 terracotta golems per village

My idea is similar too, except that I think it should be clay instead of terracotta, because traditionally it's what golems are made of. I think they should be found in villages more frequently than iron golems, because it's probably easier to sculpt and we already know villagers use clay. They would hit less hard than iron golems but could have special abilities, for example, absorbing punches or changing shape (this could be useful for sneaking in small spaces and going through things like fences).

My idea is you craft a Terracotta golem with 1 Terracotta block and 1 pumpkin. But it is just the sell. You then must find a Rune. Runes have different types that are different personalities.

You find Runes in archaeology desert and jungle temples and deepdark.

Once you have a Rune you can add it to the golem body. This will turn it into the golem. The life the golem has is the Rune. Meaning if the body breaks and the Rune is safe. Your golem is alive still. They have a level system and you can tell them to follow you and stuff. The Runes are different personalities. Each one effects villages and have likes and dislikes.

 

A Jolly Golem will play with baby villagers and dance to music. But a creepy golem will hide in the shadows and walk like a zombie.

They are very breakable. They take alot of fall damage(4 block fall is death)
Idea: What if it was fire proof? Realistically, terracotta is fire-proof, which would make this mob just a slightly more defensive but weaker attacker of a golem.

In the Mythology the Golems where made of burned clay and brought alive by an alchemist by putting a scroll with simple commands like 'protect' or 'dig a whole' into theyre mouth.

Maybe you could 'bring alive' a golem by feeding a carved pumpkin on a clay or teracotta golem T structure with a paper.
@Mc rat yeah good idea
They already do have a chance of having their parents professions.
Baby Villagers are too young to do any sort of trading.
@Blast Burner Yes, they would not know how to gather or craft the material.
If they can't craft or gather material, then what is the support for this post?
Are there laws against that?

@Azrhei I don't think so (I only know the basic laws: speeding, harassment, destruction of property, etc.) Now researching it, I think there are laws against it, but who says there are laws against it in Minecraft?
Are You Sure This Isn't Illegal I Don't Think You Can Get A Job Until Your Atleast 16-18 Years Old
It would not be a job. Not any more than a lemonade stand is a job. They would only trade minor items. (flowers, snowballs, sticks, maybe sweet berries at best)
"Samurai" it's not logically. Ya, I know that villager should defense themselves but not this way! Give them a stick and they will fight.
Seems Weak A Stick Really Maybe A Sword But A Stick Are You Kidding Me

Changed It To Ninja Villager And Vindicators Are Very Strong Villagers Will Not Be Able To Fight Them In Patrols And Raids And Pillagers Are Ranged So Yeah This Is A Great Way To Defend Your Villagers From Threats

Great Idea! It bothers me a lot that villagers are helpless and run away from the mobs. It would be terrific if there are villagers that can defend themselves and fight you if you hit them with a sword. When villagers are helpless, players will assume that villagers are a joke and they are not valuable to the game. Having this ability will make Minecraft more fun.
I think the Iron Golem would be okay..  Ninja villagers just make defending a village too easy, and it just gets out of taste of the village themes.
This is an excellent idea!
I have always seen witches as a solo mob, not realy helping any body and almost nutrill.
I'll vote this just so mojang will add a new type of golem to help defend villages .
The term ‘indian’ refers To a person from India, and not a Native American like you refer to.

I would like to bring a new idea about the Insomniac illager. Like witches, this one would have his own house. It would be a quick made shelter hiden in a hole, findable in forest biomes. We could find some elements inside with logic behind. A bed, candles, a lectern and bookshelves ( to make researchs about their curse ), a clock on a wall (to check the time), a cat (to scare phantoms) and barrels with content ( magic stuff, phantoms membranes, milk and sweet food that could cure insomnia for players).

The insomniac illager inside would never despawn and would be automatically hostile because breaking into his house would be an agression.

It would give a related structure to this illager as every illagers have related structures, and reduce randomness by giving to players the possibility to get this mob (and insomnia) by explorating instead of waiting during night to get one spawning.
HECK YEAH THATS POG
A beekeeper could be a new villager job too
And hunter

A Villager Baker - I could trade Milk, Eggs, Sugar, all sorts of baking ingredients, and baked goods. Extra vanilla beans would be cooked to grow and collect, and being able to make vanilla extract for some new baked goods would be cool.  

A horse trainer - can buy or sell horses to them

A cow herder - buy beef skins extra, also being able to sell these items 

Chicken herder - Buy and sell chicken, seeds, and eggs

More job variety is definitely a plus, as it increases the utility of villages and increases their potential scale you can expand them to without too much job duplication.
Some ideas for new villagers that I would like to see introduced

An alchemist, who buys ingredients and sells potions
A carpenter, who buys and sells a wide variety of wood and wood products
A jeweller, who buys and sells precious stones and metals
An innkeeper, who spawns with an inn building with spare beds, where villagers congregate at nightfall, and sells food and ale
A childminder, who doesn't trade but whose presence increases the rate of breeding
An astronomer, who buys glass and copper and sells telescopes and compasses
A beekeeper, who buys flowers and sells honey
A fur trader, who buys rabbit hides and sells fur lined armour for cold biomes
A bank who will look after your possessions for a small fee, and crucially, these can be accessed from any bank in any village
A lookout, who doesn't trade but stands at the highest point in the village and gives early warning of approaching illagers or hostile mobs by blowing a horn
Maybe even have ender mobs attack nether mobs or any mob that lives in cold Biomes attack any warm desert mobs like husks .
This would be awesome to be in game and would make their trades worth wild, because then you don't have to find a jungle to make a auto bamboo farm. And make me less likely to kill them on site.

Bards can heal with their music

Bards play music during the afternoon gathering

When music is played, villagers have higher chance of breeding

Small animals flock towards the bard's music: Rabbits, cats, dogs...

@Yehia_gaming a human npc it will have multiple skins including Steve and Alex skin, they will spawn in the overworld seen defending villages or maybe their own towns from hostile mobs. They will mine, craft items, and basically do things like the player with limitations like being able to fight bosses by themselves, they will use any weapon, can't use totem of undying, nor items like spawn eggs , they will have the same amount of health as the player and a hunger bar . if you recruit them they will follow, guard, fight, and mine with you . they will also be able to carry items for you .

When you post an idea maybe add more description to it rather than just telling them "hey add this" just saying
um... this sounds a lot like slavery, just saying... maybe they could have a trust meter that has to be maxed out before they help you, and some might even be hostile to start out with.
Minecraft is a game about endless possibilities you can make villagers your slaves if you like lol . if anything this post in general needs more detail and reason
... so you agree with slavery? but does anyone agree with a trust meter?

The game has a laid back style to it meaning you can do whatever you want . even if they add a trust meter you can simply go into creative mode on single player and just spawn them with command blocks . So no i don't agree with slavery because it's not slavery at all.
Iron golem farms are used for slavery if you think About it
Yes, i love this idea. The village needs to be an old western town, and there could be an old western bank building with a chest instead of a blacksmith

and with all the new mod packs for witchcraft etc. why isn't there a Cowboy hat for that Horse tamer achieve or maybe it lets you ride faster/ jump higher or just look good!. could also have cowboy boots  to complete the look of the Leather outfits. making leather a more desirable attire.
Agreed. Minecraft stands with the idea of black rights matter and the LGBTQ community, so a default skin on java for this would be amazing. Voted!
i wish we had more player variants besides alex and steve too. it would add more lore to the game and also fix representation
There's multiple skins to choose from lol
But why add another default skin? You can literally import custom skins the two defaults are just because there are two player models, one with thicker arms and one with thinner arms.

I would like to see nonbinary characters. Steve and Alex represent masculinity and femininity. I would love to see a "Jordan" and a "Taylor" representing enbininity, with a Steve-build and longer hair and with an Alex-build and short hair. Just some enby presence would be great. Add some main characters representing different (non-Euro) irl ethnicities by having like four or five Steves and Alexes
This may be a bit too op i think it would be nice to be able to capture mobs/animals and thats what it would sell.
Thank you developers for adding awesome content. You guys are awesome! Please vote this mob if you want their to be a humanoid in minecraft. Every vote counts!
You know they haven't added it yet, RobinHood968?
Superbe idée ca va tous nous servir . Merci .
I think it's a Bit hard to Programm that, because they would somehow need to recognize that some zombified villager just got cured, but it's an good Idea.
They can already recongize that a zombie villager got cured, as they lower their trading prices when this occurs.
Just combine two fortune II books on an anvil
you got unlucky big f

I believe the type and level of enchanted books sold by librarians are randomly (and evenly) generated, so this would require a special modification for Fortune III alone. I don't think this is likely to materialize. If you're not already, keep replacing the lectern; in my anecdotal experience it's quite common.

I really need this personally me and my friends, 5 of us spent hours grinding to get a fortune III book from five different viallgers and gave up, then I tried to get my sharpness V book due to stress of trying to get my stupid fortune, and got it almost instantly, after I wasted all my levels trying to get fortune three (wasted, I didn't get it) but finally got it via end bust, I either have the worst luck in the world or its impossible,

btw its easy to get fortune III on iron picks usually I was trying to get my diamond pick fortuned out

and the problem with getting fortune II is that that is hard to get also, and the whole books are generate evenly is silly because you can always get lower base trades such as protection II and sharpness III, but not high lvl base trades or random necessities such as aqua affinity, depth strider three, sharpness five, any fortune, and even sil touch!
That's unlucky man. I was hoping for either mending, unbreaking or fortune 1 2 or 3 but on my 4th try I got fortune 3.

I got a fortune 3 book from a librarian for 29 emeralds and 1 book. But then as soon as I got enough emeralds, a villager walked by and took the job of that librarian and now it is reseted. Now, i can't get fortune 3 back
took me literally around 20 tries and got fortune 3 for only 17 ems so ur just unlucky bro
I feel feel like this might be too complicated for some players to understand
It should wear off though I’d think

This is a really cool idea and give real consequence for players intentionally bringing danger toward trusting and unsuspecting villagers.

I agree with AsasinTrashBag that there should be a time where the area of suspicion resets. Maybe reset every 10 days after they first raid. That should be over an hour (100 minutes) even with sleeping cutting time.
I was going to discuss ways to lower your suspicion level, but I reached the character limit. 10 days without a raid to lower a suspicion level by 1 seems reasonable enough to me.
Uh, Okay ?
Every house would have a mailbox, but there could only be one postman. All the mailboxes would be considered the postman's "workstation"
